marno.client

Class SocketClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • marno.client.Client
      • marno.client.SocketClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SocketClient
extends Client
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The socket implementation of the Marno client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean listening
      Whether the client is currently listening for input from the server.
      private java.lang.Thread mainThread
      Main client thread.
      private java.lang.Thread pingThread
      Secondary thread which constantly pings the server, to keep the connection active.
      private java.io.BufferedReader socketIn
      The input stream used to receive commands from the server.
      private java.io.PrintStream socketOut
      The output stream used to send commands to the server.
      private java.net.Socket socketServer
      The server-side socket, read for incoming commands.

      • Fields inherited from class marno.client.Client

        username, window

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SocketClient(ClientGUI window)
      Ties the client to its GUI window.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void connect(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String port)
      Initiates a connection with the specified server, then starts two threads: one to receive input from the server, another to continuously ping it.
      (package private) void disconnect()
      Closes the connection with the server.
      private void handleInput(java.lang.String input)
      Handle the commands from the server, and update the graphical elements.
      void run()
      Listens for incoming messages from the server.
      (package private) void sendMessageToServer(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a public message to the server.
      (package private) void sendPrivateMessageToServer(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String message)
      Sends a private message to another client connected to the server.

    • Field Detail

      • socketServer

        private java.net.Socket socketServer
        The server-side socket, read for incoming commands. Warning: The socket should not be read from directly. Use socketIn instead.

      • socketOut

        private java.io.PrintStream socketOut
        The output stream used to send commands to the server.

      • socketIn

        private java.io.BufferedReader socketIn
        The input stream used to receive commands from the server.

      • listening

        private volatile boolean listening
        Whether the client is currently listening for input from the server.

      • mainThread

        private java.lang.Thread mainThread
        Main client thread. Listens for input from the server.

      • pingThread

        private java.lang.Thread pingThread
        Secondary thread which constantly pings the server, to keep the connection active.

        Ties the client to its GUI window.
        Parameters:
        window - the client's main GUI window

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String host,
             java.lang.String port)
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Initiates a connection with the specified server, then starts two threads: one to receive input from the server, another to continuously ping it.
        Specified by:
        connect in class Client
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname of the server
        port - the port number of the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • disconnect

         throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the connection with the server.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in class Client
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the client is unable to disconnect cleanly

                                java.lang.String message)
                         throws java.lang.Exception

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
